Clicking on the app doesn't open a new window. It puts up a notification that states which sink it's switching to. Just keep clicking to cycle through all the available sinks. Currently I have 3: analog (line out jack), HDMI and a Bluetooth headset sink and it works with all of them.

I also have the pulseaudio volume control installed and often need to open it, go to the configuration tab and turn HDMI and analog off in order to get the Bluetooth headset sink to work. Mind I had to do that even before installing this switcher so it's not a bug in this switcher.

This app does what it says, switches between sinks, so 5 stars from me.
Just pops up a window stating "Switching to" and doesn't do anything. If this is operator error, then more explicit instructions would be nice. We're not all linux nerds.

You need add to favorites on your desktop or left panel and only click. Its like button who changed your preferences output sound. Like i have 3 output. And i need go evry time in preferens to cange output for sound. With its app i can only click in icon. 

Y, its not perfect solution, but In Ubuntu 20.10 there is no tray icon to change the sound output. This app help you

Works well! Pin the icon to favorites, hit it, and it cycles through sound outputs. Perfect for what I need with always plugged in headphones and speakers, no more going into settings!

Thank you.

I can get the Dialogue boxes flashing up at the top of the screen but only @Switching to@ appears , I am asuming it should read Switching to say UDMI,USB or PC sound system, either way It does not seem to work. Given it 3 stars as it probably did work at one time.
